summary.en: One reason the politics of immigration and inequality have been muted in Norway is that “we have the cushion of the wealth fund,” says Nikolai Brandal, a historian. As it hits its limits, big parties like Labour and the Conservatives will face more pressure. And Europe’s most moderate populist party may become less well-behaved.

title.en: How to tame your dragon. Norway’s centre-right coalition is re-elected
